Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the curve or trace.
Column Comment.2: DIGITAL CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the digital log curve interval.
Column Comment.3: CURVE SCALE IDENTIFIER: Code identifying the scale.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CURVE SCALE IDENTIFIER: Code identifying the scale.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH: Curve bottom depth. The maximum depth of the curve data recordedduring the logging pass.
Column Comment.7: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LEFT SCALE VALUE: Value of the scale at the left track margin.
Column Comment.11: LOG MATRIX LITHOLOGY SETTING: This reference table identifies the type oflithologic material present in the rock being evaluated. For example, sandstone,limestone.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: RIGHT SCALE VALUE : Value of the scale at the right track margin.
Column Comment.15: SCALE TRANSFORM TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of scalingtransform. For example, linear, log, compressed or hybrid.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: TOP DEPTH: Curve top depth. The minimum depth of the curve data recorded duringthe logging pass.
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: TRACK NUMBER the number(s) of the track that were digitized such as T1, 23.
Column Comment.20: TRACK WIDTH: The width of the track that was digitized.
Column Comment.21: TRACK WIDTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.23: VERTICAL SCALE RATIO: Number indicating the ratio on a vertical scale of themeasured depth to plot depth (e.g., 240:1).
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
